intro: Struthanthus spicatus, commonly known as the spiny scaleflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiny bracts that surround its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Struthanthus spicatus is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, showcasing its resilience and ecological significance in its native habitat.
